required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of the Anesthetic Effect on the Activity of Immune Cell in Patient With Breast Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of the Anesthetic Effect on the Activity of Immune Cell in Patient With Breast Cancer

brief_summary.textblock:
Anesthetics agents has variety inflammation during the cancer surgery. This perioperative inflammation can influence to cancer metastasis or recurrence.
The purpose of this study is to prove the variation of immune cell activity between preoperative and postoperative period.

detailed_description.textblock:
The patients were allocated randomly to receive propofol or sevoflurane. Also, a total of 18ml of blood sample was obtained for total 3 times in consecutive order.
1. immediate before anesthesia induction
2. postoperative 1 hours
3. postoperative 24 hours
Serum in blood will be obtained and activity of helper T cell, natural killer cell and level of serum cytokine will be evaluated by flow cytometry or enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: CD39 and CD73 on circulating regualtory T cells
primary_outcome.time_frame: preoperative time. postoperative 1 hours and 24 hours
primary_outcome.description: change of percentage of CD39 and CD73 (scores range from 0 to 100)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: preoperative time. postoperative 1 hours and 24 hours
secondary_outcome.description: change of percentage of circulating natural killer cell (scores range from 0 to 100)

other_outcome.measure: Circulating type 1 and type 17 helper T cells
other_outcome.time_frame: preoperative time. postoperative 1 hours and 24 hours
other_outcome.description: change of percentage of helper T cell (scores range from 0 to 100)

arm_group.description: The patient who anesthetized by using propofol.
The patient who anesthetized by using propofol

intervention.description: Patient will be anesthetized by using propofol infusion during operation.
Patient will be anesthetized by using sevoflurane inhalation during operation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patient who was planned to undergo colon cancer surgery.
Exclusion Criteria:
- age < 20 years old
- history of hypersensitivity reaction in propofol or sevoflurane
- history of previous cancer
- patient with ongoing inflammation
